goal: Define biome-based wildlife spawn tables with activity cycles, make behaviors react to time/weather, and surface richer observation from the cabin terrace and in the field.
decisions: Keep the existing species roster but gate spawn locations by biome bands (desert west, spring north, winter east, lake center) and time-of-day activity (diurnal/nocturnal/crepuscular).
Use a lightweight activity-state update that factors time of day and severe weather (rain/blizzard/sandstorm reduces movement/hunting).
Observation detail scales with observation skill; terrace view offers a direction-based snapshot with distance hints.
plan: Refine spawn tables: map species -> native biomes + spawn weights per region; seed spawns accordingly and allow rare lake/edge sightings.
Update wildlife update loop to respect activity schedules and weather dampening; add simple distance-aware movement limits per biome band.
Add observation outputs: terrace directional look shows nearby wildlife with distance bands; field descriptions include activity cues scaled by observation skill.
Smoke test commands (look/observe/terrace) to ensure no panics and messages show activity/weather influences.
notes: No new species or items; focus on behavior/observation fidelity.
